intro: Dispara filiformis, commonly known as the slender dispara, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes a wide variety of orchids. The plant is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
